**Figure 1.** Ionic strength-dependence of the intrinsic binding constant and cooperativity parameter of codilin binding to actin filaments. (a) Cofilin concentration-dependence of the binding density at 25 mM (black), 50 mM (red), \(\overline{n}\)0 mM (green), 200 mM (blue) and 300 mM (pink) KCl. The continuous lines through the data represent the best fits of the data to equation (4). The inset shows the same data plotted in the Scatchard format. (b) Ionic strength-dependence of intrinsic binding constant \(K_{a}\). (c) Ionic strength-dependence of cooperativity parameter \(\overline{n}\). The continuous lines in (b) and (c) are the best fits to equation (6). Conditions: pH 6.6, 25 \({}^{\circ}\)C, 0.2 mM ATP, 2 mM MgCl\({}_{2}\), 2 mM DTT, 1 mM NaN, 20 mM imidazole, the indicated [KCl].

**Figure 3.** Kinetics of non-centiguous cofilin binding to an isolated site on an actin filament. The inset shows the time-course of 0.5 mM cofilin binding to 7 mM pyrene actin filaments. The continuous line through the data is the best fit to a single-exponential with observed rate constant of 0.147 s \({}^{-1}\). Conditions: pH 6.6, 25 \({}^{\circ}\)C, 50 mM KCl, 0.2 mM ATP, 2 mM MgCl\({}_{2}\), 2 mM DTT, 1 mM NaN\({}_{2}\), 20 mM imidazole.
